lines.text: [last lines]
Hello, air-raid headquarters? Well, you're not gonna believe this, but I just saw a genie with light brown hair chasing a flying sorceress.
Magic mirror on the wall. Who is the ugliest one of all?
there's none that's uglier than thou.

[to the audience]
I'm so deathly afraid of getting prettier as I grow older. Pretty?
[cackles insanely]

[after sharpening her meat cleaver]
There, that's sharp enough to split a hare. Split a hare?
[cackles insanely]

[singing]
A cup of arsenic, a spider, some glue / A lizard's gizzard, an eel's ear or two.

[about Witch Hazel]
She may not be very pretty now, but she was someone's baby once.
I warn you, dearie. I'm going to worm all your ugly secrets out of you. Tell me. Who undoes your hair?
Do you like it?
Like it? Why, it's absolutely *hideous*!
I did myself up tonight.
There's nothing like a home permanent.

[about Halloween]
Say, this trick-or-treating is a pretty sweet racket. Pity it only comes once a year.

[upon entering her magic broom closet]
Hi ho sliver! Away!
[a broom flies out of the closet with Hazel on, then starts sweeping the floor. Hazel falls off]

[to the audience]
Crazy me... that was my sweeping broom.
[chuckles silently]
Evening, granny. Do you have any goodies for a Halloween witch?

[confused]
Witch? I don't remember seeing her at any of the union meetings.
[complementing the costume]
But my, isn't she the ugliest little thing?
[laughs]

[suddenly worried]
Ugly?
[to the genie]
Magic mirror on the wall. Who is the ugliest one of all?
Thou wert the ugliest one, 'tis true. But that creep is uglier far than you!
You know, my delicate inner sense of danger warns me that there's something faintly unhealthy in the atmosphere of this cottage.
[Witch Hazel stops him at the door, brandishing a meat cleaver]
Uh, pardon me, auntie, but uh, I've got a lot a trick-or-treatin' to catch up on so I'll bid you a civil adieu!
